name: dampener
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
something that makes something less active, less exciting, or less enjoyable: Interest rate rises may act as a dampener on the market. Lack of enthusiasm from restaurant staff can be as great a dampener as lukewarm coffee. See also
put a damper on something informal
a device that reduces vibration (= continuous quick, slight shaking movement): It was common to see rubber bands used as vibration dampeners on tennis rackets. Synonym
damper
More examplesFewer examplesThe only dampener on the evening is that while the material is good it doesn't always get the laughs it deserves.There are many who believe seeding the tournament teams to be a bad idea - a dampener, rather than a stimulant.Oil price rises actually proved to be a market dampener.You're full of brilliant ideas but along comes a dampener of dreams in the form of a sensible friend.The system is solidly built, with vibration dampeners, cooling and a high-spec power supply.It has a bracket to mount a steering dampener.
